component.name: Gaia Sky
component.developer_name: Zentrum für Astronomie der Universität Heidelberg

description.p: Gaia Sky is an astronomy visualization platform for desktop and VR that runs on Linux, Windows and macOS. It is developed in the framework of ESA's Gaia mission to chart about 1 billion stars of our Galaxy in the Gaia group of the Astronomisches Rechen-Institut (ZAH, Universität Heidelberg). Explore the Solar System, the Milky Way, and even the most distant galaxies of our Universe with up-to-date, real scientific data.
This release introduces significant rendering improvements and engine optimizations:

ul.li: Major rendering overhaul: New PBR pipeline with Cook-Torrance BRDF, true 3D volume rendering, and improved atmospheric scattering.
Virtual Reality: Enhanced OpenXR performance, new VR demo mode, and desktop mirroring optimizations.
Anaglyph and Stereo: Added new Dubois-style modes and adaptive stereo separation controls.
UI/UX: New dynamic accent color system, improved visibility panels, and updated translations for multiple languages.
Engine: Performance gains via instanced rendering for orbits and a more robust multi-mirror data download system.
Resolved several VR-related crashes on Linux and improved shutdown sequences.
Fixed atmospheric diffraction effects and cloud projection during eclipses.
Corrected FOV scaling calculations to improve label and visibility accuracy across zoom levels.
Fixed various procedural generation glitches and UI layout inconsistencies.
